feedback: Many functions and classes lack docstrings or comments explaining their purpose and usage.
Some comments are vague and do not provide enough context for understanding the code.
There are instances of commented-out code that should either be removed or explained.
suggestions: Add docstrings to all classes and methods to describe their functionality and parameters.
Provide more context in comments, especially for complex logic or non-obvious code sections.
Remove or clarify any commented-out code to avoid confusion.
strengths: Some comments provide basic context for certain sections of the code.
The use of comments to indicate where to load environment variables is helpful.
